intro: Helipterum fuscescens, commonly known as the dark purple everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces small, dark purple to violet flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical heads. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it suitable for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Its evergreen foliage and long-lasting blooms make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
